incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

incidents.name: Cache Purging Delays in Western North America

incident_updates.body: We have identified the cause of this issue and implemented a fix. We are currently monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - CDN Cache Purge

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare single-file cache purging (purge by URL) called via the Dashboard/API is running up to 30 minutes behind in Western North America. This also affects the "Always Online" feature.

We are working to resolve this issue as soon as possible. Until then you may use the Purge Everything feature but do be aware it may cause a surge in traffic to your origin server(s). More updates to follow.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - CDN Cache Purge

incidents.name: Stream video uploads processing slowly

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved.

Queue is recovering and encoding jobs are completing. New uploads should be available normally, videos currently encoding should complete shortly. Team is continuing to investigate. Playback and live broadcasts were unaffected.
Stream is investigating delays in new uploaded videos being ready to play. Playback is unaffected. Stream Live is unaffected.
Stream is currently investigating delays in new uploaded videos being ready to play.

incidents.name: Accidental "major incident" notification

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We understand how concerning it must have been to receive an unexpected email about a major incident. The message you may have received was sent in error. During a routine internal drill, a test notification was inadvertently distributed externally.

Please rest assured there is no active major issue impacting Cloudflare services â€” everything is operating normally.

Weâ€™re truly sorry for any confusion or worry this may have caused you or your team. No action is needed on your side, and you can safely disregard that email. For the most accurate and up-to-date information at any time, please refer to our Cloudflare Status Page (https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/).

Thank you for your understanding, and for trusting Cloudflare.

incidents.name: Issues with new Cloudflare Tunnel and WARP connections on 2025-08-10

incident_updates.body:
An issue prevented a subset of new Cloudflare Tunnel and WARP connections from being established between 07:00 and 08:45 AM UTC on Sunday, August 10th. This problem has been fully resolved, and all services are operating normally.

During this time window, customers may have experienced errors when attempting to restart or initiate new connections via cloudflared. This may also have impacted customers using WARP-to-WARP connectivity or Magic WAN customers who leverage WARP as an on-ramp.

The issue was limited to the establishment of new connections; existing tunnels and connections were not affected. This issue also did not affect any other Cloudflare services.

Our team has addressed the root cause, and we will continue to monitor the service to ensure continued stability. We apologize for any disruption this may have caused our customers.
